ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: music theories around pop music, ways to analyze and evaluate

I learned about a variety of music theory concepts within the context of contemporary music, providing a strong framework for understanding and analyzing these works. I gained exposure to new genres of music, and sharpened my critical listening skills.

Learned about song structure, harmony, rhythm, production, and more generally how to think critically about popular music. As a classical musician, I took away from this class a broader understanding of what music theory is and what its purpose should bebefore, I thought of theory as a statement of this is how music works deep down, but now I view theory as just one way to describe or explain what I hear as I listen.
Improved my overall understanding of music theory and completely changed the way I listen to pop music!
This course gave me a great understanding on a relatively basic level of music theory in pop music. I learned a lot about how to listen to contemporary music in a more focused way.
I gained the ability to break down complex songs into more understandable components.
Went through some basic understanding of rhythm, meter, melody, chord progression, scales, form, and some structure and themes of popular songs
I learned a lot during this course; I of course learned music theory, but there were also some meaningful teachings about the tropes/typicalities of the music industry, etc.

I learned an insane amount of music theory through fun pop music. Although we never played instruments in class, I play piano and guitar better than before because of how much I learned from this course. This is my favorite course I've taken at Yale.
How to analyze pop music
I learned so much in this course about how to analyze popular music, as well as about copyright law and how music is written.

How to analyze a pop song in multiple different ways (rhythm, chord progression etc.). Basic musical terms and the ability to understand different parts of a song and how they might differ from song to song.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strength: very hands on
weakness: it can be my own problem but when it comes to more advanced topic like chords it's a bit fast for people with no background

The organization of the course is great; there was a logical build-up of concepts from simple to more complex, and our toolbox for understanding music expanded throughout the semester. The class size was great for encouraging plenty of participation. The assignments were very painless, often taking less than 30 minutes a week. I wish that the specifics of the course material were more clear from the start, however. Having experience writing and arranging my own music as well as playing a few instruments, I felt that the course was pretty easy and I came away with less new knowledge than I expected. A more advanced course of the same flavor would be wonderful.

Strengths: great and knowledgable professor, reasonable workload and flexibility (weekly assignments were super manageable), goes over student examples, smart and amazing TA (Hallie) who made discussion sections fun and interesting.

Weaknesses: None really

Strengths: highly engaging, fun class, good discussion
Weaknesses: minimal feedback on assignments

Classes were fun and I thought the teaching team did a really great job with both the classes and how forgiving they were when it came to deadlines and assignments.
The only weakness I felt was that I didnt feel like I got that much feedback or direction in general with my assignments.
A strength was the sections - I particularly liked the chord progression worksheet and our analysis based in.

The class was interesting, and I definitely learned more about pop music. The assignments were engaging and fun, it was mainly finding songs we enjoy and doing our own analysis of them. That being said, I wish that we had gone a little bit more in depth into the music theory. We spent a lot of time going over homework assignments, which were good illustrations of examples, but I thought some of that time could've been used to learn more topics.
This course was extremely organized, informative, and fun. I'm grateful for Professor Adam's genuineness and intelligence.

I loved how this course gave us the skills needed to analyze popular music. It is super cool to know listen to a song on the radio and be able to do a brief analysis in my head. I also really enjoyed the format with most material being taught through listening examples in class.

Strengths: the difficulty of the course increased gradually as we gained new skills. Having a TA as well as Professor Adam gave us freedom to ask a bunch of questions.
Weaknesses: A lot of time was spent on listening to songs that were brought in as opposed to learning theory that was directly taught to us.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Since it provides effective angles to look at pop music which everyone likes

I would recommend this course to any musician or enjoyer of music who feels that their theory knowledge needs work. This class is a fun way to learn concepts deeply useful to any musician. I would say that if you can identify the chord progression of a four chord pop song by ear without much hesitation, this class is likely too easy for you. If you can't, this class is perfect for you.

Yes! Great and fun way to fulfill lessons requirement. If you want to chill and get your credit, you can do that, but Prof. Adam and Hallie are so knowledgable that if you want to learn a ton about pop music, you can learn as much as you want just by talking to them after class.
Yes!
Yes, if theyre at all interested by pop music and music theory then this is a really great class to take.
Yes! A very great introduction to pop music theory

If you're looking for a relatively low workload but interesting class about music theory, I definitely would recommend. If you have a strong background in music theory though, you probably will already know most of what is talked about in this class.
I recommend this course to every single one of my friends that's into music. It's engaging, exciting, fun, and stimulating.
If you're into pop music and music theory this course is for u

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student because it teaches you the skills in order to be able to analysis and transcribe popular music. We also had very interesting discussions in class about copyright law and originality which were very engaging and fascinating to consider.
Yes! Fun, relaxed course. I was probably at the lower end of music theory comprehension going in, but I still managed to learn a lot from the class and from my classmates.
